title: Forecasting Dark Ages Constraints for LuSEE
text:
Introduction
Calculate likelihoods for Dark Ages and CMB signal separation, using HOSVD to calculate independent combinations of visibility data.

title: 1  Introduction
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.




Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput. J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: 4  Summary
text: In summary, this book has no content whatsoever.

title: 1  Likelihood Calculation
text:
The HOSVD gives us basis vectors for linear combinations of antenna combinations and common beam angles as follows.

from simflows.load import eigs
eigs['eig:combs'].sel(combs2=[0,1,2,3,4]).plot.line(x='combs')








Figure 1.1: combination eigenmodes from HOSVD





eigs['eig:angles'].sel(angles2=[0,1,2,3,4]).plot.line(x='angles')








Figure 1.2: angle eigenmodes from HOSVD

title: 2  Likelihood Calculation
text: The HOSVD gives us basis vectors for linear combinations of antenna combinations and common beam angles as follows.

title: 1  Higher Order Singular Value Decomposition
text:
Generalization of the usual SVD for tensors. Usual SVD proceeds via the following decomposition \(A=USV^{T}\) or in tensor notation, \[
A^{\alpha\beta} = U^{\alpha}_{\alpha'} V^{\beta}_{\beta'} S^{\alpha'\beta'}
\] where each of \(U, V\) are the eigenvector matrices of the covariance matrices of the respective indices of \(A\), given by the usual \(C^{\beta_1\beta_2}=\frac{1}{\sqrt{d_{\alpha}}}A^{\alpha\beta_1}A_{\alpha}^{\beta_2}\) and \(C^{\alpha_1\alpha_2}=\frac{1}{\sqrt{d_{\beta}}}A^{\alpha_1\beta}A^{\alpha_2}_{\beta}\)
The HOSVD generalizes this to higher order tensors \(A^{\alpha\beta\gamma\delta}\), by performing the SVD on each mode of the tensor (De Lathauwer, De Moor, and Vandewalle 2000). The decomposition is given by




De Lathauwer, Lieven, Bart De Moor, and Joos Vandewalle. 2000. “A Multilinear Singular Value Decomposition.” SIAM Journal on Matrix Analysis and Applications 21 (4): 1253–78. https://doi.org/10.1137/S0895479896305696.
crumbs: 1  Higher Order Singular Value Decomposition

title: 2  \(W_{ij\nu}\) optimizer using JAX
text:
LuSEE simulation objects are given as tensors \(S^{ij\nu\tau}\) where \(i,j\) are antenan indices, \(\nu\) is frequency and \(\tau\) is timestep. The optimizer allows us to write \[
S^
\]
